ygData.subject: RE: Hey this sounded interesting..
ygData.msgSnippet: If that s your logic why are bards rogue/enchanters?  We cannot enchant anything.  We have pathetic unuseable rogue abilities.  We are hardly a combination of
ygData.messageBody:
If that's your logic why are bards rogue/enchanters? We cannot enchant
anything. We have pathetic unuseable rogue abilities. We are hardly a
combination of the two unless Andy Warhol is a deity in this world too.

Kookoocachoo I am the Diceman

-----Original Message-----
From: Greg Gillan [mailto:GGillan@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 30, 1999 3:17 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hey this sounded interesting..


From: Greg Gillan <GGillan@...>

Where did you get this idea? Hybrid means a "combination of two different
things", not "he who fights with slashing weapons".

i.e.:
Ranger = warrior + druid
Paladin = warrior + cleric
Shadow Knight = warrior + necromancer
Bard = rogue + enchanter + . . . .

What are druids/clerics/shaman a combination of? They are not hybrids.


Elwyn Heartstring
Level 44 Bard
Erollisi Marr


From: "Lange, Stephen" <SLANGE@...>

>They are not hybrids, they are the priest classes.

A hybrid is considered any class that can use slashing weapons or armor.
Druids and Shaman can. Pure Casters cannot. Ask yourself, does the Druid
or Shaman follow the same weapon/armor rules as a Pure Caster (Mage/Wizard).
Clerics are the oddball, in that they can wear armor.
